SEARCH
Package Tekiz._DPSCalculator._DPSCalculator.model.perks

Class Perk<V>

java.lang.Object
Tekiz._DPSCalculator._DPSCalculator.model.perks.Perk<V>
Type Parameters:
V - The type of value used for the modifier effects, such as Integer or Double.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Modifier
public class Perk<V> extends Object implements Modifier
Represents a perk modifier that adds various effects to a user's loadout based on the current rank. Each perk has a condition that must be met which will then apply effects based on the rank of the perk. A rank cannot be higher than the total amount of effect ranks and cannot be lower than 1.

  • Field Details

    • name

      private final String name
      The name of the perk. The user will be able to see the given value.

    • rank

      private int rank
      The current rank of the perk. This corresponds to the effects given. The set rank cannot be below 1 or above the highest rank of effects.

    • description

      private final String description
      The description of the effects a perk provides.

    • modifierSource

      private final ModifierSource modifierSource
      The source type of the modifier (ModifierSource). This is used by the ModifierBoostService to apply a modification to the perks effects if a corresponding effect is available.

    • condition

      private final org.springframework.expression.Expression condition
      The condition required to use the perk. If the condition is not met, the effects will not be applied. ExpressionDeserializer will take the string value of the property "conditionString" and convert it into an expression. ModifierConditionLogic is used to check the condition. If a condition string is not included, the perk will always be used.

    • effects

      private final HashMap<Integer,HashMap<ModifierTypes,V>> effects
      The effects of the perk. Each perk can have multiple effects that will be applied per rank. An effect consists of a ModifierTypes and a value (Integer or Double). If an effect requires additional logic to determine the applied value, use "ADDITIONAL_CONTEXT_REQUIRED" alongside the name of perk. This will be used by the ModifierExpressionService to determine the appropriate value.

  • Constructor Details

    • Perk

      public Perk()

  • Method Details

    • setRank

      public void setRank(int newRank)
      Sets the rank of the perk, ensuring that it remains within valid bounds. If the new rank is less than or equal to 0, the rank is set to 1. If the new rank exceeds the highest available rank in effects, the rank is capped.
      Parameters:
      newRank - The new rank to set for the perk.

    • getEffects

      public HashMap<ModifierTypes,V> getEffects()
      Retrieves the effects associated with the current rank of the perk. Each rank provides a different set of effects that modify specific stats.
      Specified by:
      getEffects in interface Modifier<V>
      Returns:
      A map of ModifierTypes to their corresponding values for the current rank. Returns null if no effects are defined.
